content: >insertcreativetitlehere< versionl 0 these socks are based on designs by betty salpekar please check out her book solefully knitting unlike her designs my socks are completely adjustable for length and width can be selected individually i just loved the idea of starting completely differently than standard socks and hope you enjoy these socks as much as i enjoyed designing them if you have any questions or want to point out possible errors please e-mail me at this address the nerd knits@gmx de i would be very happy if you could tag me on instagram when showing these socks @the nerd knits happy knitting annette 1 materials circular needle suitable for magic loop at least 80 cm / 32 long maybe a second circular needle one size larger for colourwork sections stitch markers 2 skeins of yarn with good contrast 80 g of each colour should actually be enough for most sock sizes one colour should be solid the other one can be colourful as long as colours do not overlap i used 2 25 mm us 1 needles opal sock yarn uni 420 m / 100 g in black as colour 1 bunte wollmaus high twist 400 m / 100 g in neon colours as colour 2 gauge 30 stitches / 42 row for 10 cm/4 in stockinette 34 stitches / 42 row for 10 cm/4 in colourwork preparations cut 1 strand of yarn of c1 per sock 100 cm / 40 abbreviations k knit make 1 stitch - by picking up the bar between the stitch you knit and the one m1 you re about to knit bringing the needle from front to back insert the right needle purlwise into the back leg of the strand and knit it s2kp slip 2 stitches together as if to knit k1 pass 2 slipped stitches over knit stitch m marker sm slip marker c1 colour 1 c2 colour 2 bor beginning of round 2 howthissockworks somenotes on colourwork generally the colourwork section is quite easy most often you will only have three stitches of one colour next to each other in some row there will be 5 stitches next to each other which still can be managed easily at beginning of row you sometimes will have 6 stitches next to each other if you don t like these long floats weave the yarn in after 3 stitches when decreasing the centre stitches there might be a few rounds that have some more c1 stitches next to each other a maximum of 11 stitches is possible but i only faced this issue once per sock i don t recommend using a ladderback method as it would only help in very few row 3 somecalculations on sizing some notes on sizes and calculations for casting on the number of stitches you will cast on depends on two factors 1 the width of the sock 2 the length of your foot decide what width you would like to go with first there are three
